intro: Tauschia tenuissima, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tauschia, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight pubescence. Tauschia tenuissima is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
